Start by drawing a square grid of 15 by: Start by drawing a square grid of 15 by 15 lines. Two players take it in turns to place a counter on any point where lines cross. The player who gets five of their counters in a straight line wins. The line can be vertical, horizontal or diagonal.

If your opponent has three in a row with nothing at either end - this is called "open 3" - then it is a good idea to use your turn to block one end. If they manage to get "open 4" you have certainly lost! A good attacking strategy might be to aim for two overlapping lines of open 3s - like a cross - so that it is very hard for your opponent to defend.
